content.description: Striking and fun slab on the left side of a gradually sweeping steeper arête. Balancy moves in a fun airy position.
content.location: central sweeping arête on the "5.9 wall"

content.description: A harder than it looks face/slab. Easy to make this harder than necessary!
content.protection: 5 bolts to easily accessed chains. variations to both sides have been done on top rope and led with some gear.
content.location: Located on the obvious slab/face left of center on the "5.9 Wall"

content.description: Fairly desperate moves characterize this optical illusion. How often do you get no hands rests on this short and hard of climb?! starts the same as positively powerful but continues left and up the groove/inside corner.
content.location: behind (west) of "5.9 wall". same start as positively powerful. can see these chains from the mountain bike trail!

content.description: Short Burly climb on primarily incut holds with minimal foot holds. trend up and right following a broken crack/seam on a lightly overhanging wall west of "5.9 wall".
content.location:
Walk around right behind (west) of the "5.9 wall"

the chains are spitting distance from the mountain bike trail!

content.description: Start far right on low, double-handed sloper then travers left past long, powerful moves on razor crimps to gain rail at mid height.  Throw to good holds and top out on the sloping prow at the heights point in the center of the boulder.
content.location: Located on the main wave-like face of the "beguiled boulder" Headed north on hwy 95 turn right into guile's connection road. Drive about 1.5 miles until a sharp left and uphill grade. Look for clearing that has a few boulders with one large boulder visible up from road. This is the "beguiled" boulder.

climbs.name: Ma Nature is a Drama Queen

content.description: Fun flakes and granite crystals lead you up the right edge of this wall. If the boulder move off the ground stumps you, you can sneak in from the right. You can watch ma nature brew up her storms over the selkirks to the southwest. If the mosquitoes are bad it can be more pleasant to belay from the top.
content.location: Right side of the West facing wall to the North of the Swamp trail platform and the "5.9 wall". Continue off-trail North when swamp trail heads to it's final platform. The climb is on the near end of the righthand wall. Can barely see "5.9 wall" thru the trees from this climb 5 minutes away.

content.description: great finger to fist crack in a deep inside corner. Great hand jams for most of the route!
content.protection: gear to 3" (nuts/hexes/tricams and cams work equally well on this varied crack)
content.location: obvious inside corner crack on "5.9 Wall"

content.description: The beautiful thin crack splitting the right vertical face on the "5.9 wall". Enjoy the boulder sequence mid route!
content.protection: Small gear and two bolts protect the smaller than desirable crack at the crux. anchor for TR is easy to access.
content.location: Start on the flake/ramp right of classic crack that leads to 2 bolts and thin crack.

content.description: First route encountered on the approach trail. characterized by vertical flakes and granite crystal knobs for the feet. Going right mid-route ups the pump and grade.
